p: Significant differences in the cell number of inflammatory monocytes, macrophages, and CD8 +IFNγ + T cells were also observed between the feet of CHIKV-NoLS CAF01-inoculated mice following the challenge ( Figures 6C,D,H). The contralateral foot had higher numbers of cells than the ipsilateral foot, suggesting that inflammatory monocytes, macrophages, and CD8 +IFNγ + T cells play a role in the rapid disease onset observed in the contralateral foot of CHIKV-NoLS CAF01-inoculated mice challenged with CHIKV.
